title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: Since DISPOSED is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with: button.DISPOSED which isn't even close to what I want, and I have to delete it all and start again, paying more attention this time. Code assist should notice that I have typed a ( and that this matches "dispose()" far better than "DISPOSED". Either that, or it needs to be case sensitive when it is automatically inserting stuff.
OB: When using the code assist feature, if the user types a ( after a variable, the code assist selects the incorrect suggestion from the list of options.
EB: When using the code assist feature, if the user types a ( after a variable, the code assist should intelligently suggest matching methods based on the context, prioritizing the suggestions that closely match the typed characters and taking into account case sensitivity.
SR:
1. Open the code editor.
2. Type a variable name followed by a (.
3. Observe the suggestions provided by the code assist feature.
4. Notice that the selected suggestion may not match the desired method.
5. Delete the incorrect suggestion and start again.
